page.title: 03FARMING AROUND BARNOLDSWICK
page.content: A normal working day on the farm: We rise at 6.30am. to bring in the cows for milking Dad and Kathryn, my sister, milk the cows whilst mum and I feed the calves, hens and goats and make breakfast. After breakfast we check the grease, diesel, oil and water in the tractors and machinery ready for siloing. Siloing takes up most of the day. The grass is cut, rowed up and collected for compression in the silo. We have a break for dinner and then at about 5.pm for tea when we again milk the cows and feed the livestock. Work usually stops at about 10.30pm.
